dlgLine.text: <You wake up to the sound of people arguing. Your body is stiff and you can smell the unmistakable scent of rubbing alcohol. You feel like you've been sleeping off a horrible fever.>
<The last thing you remember is the plane going down.>
Food? Who cares about food when we’ve got a huge hole in that fence! If we don’t fix it, they’re going to walk right in here!
I know, Mom – but who’s going to risk going out there? You? Me? Joel?
I suppose I should be the one to go, being the cop and all. Kinda be nice if someone was watchin' my back.
Not my Renee - that's for damn sure!
Let's not panic yet, alright?

dlgAnsw.text: Who the fuck are you people?! Where am I?

dlgLine.text: He's up!
She's up!
Easy... I realize you have no idea where you are right now, but you're safe - you're in the basement of a school.
Hey now - no reason for that kind of language... oh, you're up!
Speaking of panic, we're starting to get low on medical supplies. Actually, now that I think of it, I should probably change some bandages and-
Wait a sec - are you up?!
I'm Davis...
This is Anita.
You should thank your lucky stars that my daughter was here.
Mom...
That's Renee, Anita's daughter.
Uh, hi... Good to see you're up finally.
Behind her is Elaine. She's... still recovering.
And that's Joel.
That's me. I'm Joel - Officer Joel. I guess technically, it'd be Officer Oswalt - but you can call me 'Joel' - heck, any of those'll do.

dlgAnsw.text: Okay, nice to meet you all - now can someone tell me what's happening?
This isn't right - how did I get here?
I don't understand - what the hell is going on?

dlgLine.text: Do you remember the plane crash?

dlgAnsw.text: Yeah... Wish I had never gotten on that flight.
Where's the rest of my family?!

dlgLine.text: Do you remember the plane crash?

dlgAnsw.text: Not really. I can't remember much of anything...

dlgLine.text: Your family...
I don't know how to tell you this...
Your wife...
I don't know how to tell you this...
Your husband...
I don't know how to tell you this...
I don't know how to tell you this...
I'm sorry... there were only a few survivors. Between the wreckage and the... well, it was amazing that we were able to find anyone alive out there.

dlgAnsw.text: No... no, this can't be happening...
I have to go out there - I have to find them!
I can still see so many of their faces...
Could someone please tell me what the hell I'm doing here?!

dlgLine.text: You don't remember anything?
Must've been the head trauma.
You're physically fine - as far as I can tell. I'm not really sure what I can do about the memory loss.

dlgAnsw.text: I know who I am. I just don't remember the crash.

dlgLine.text: You poor thing...
I'm deeply sorry for your loss... but I'm afraid, there's some other things you have to be made aware of.
It's been a week - no one's left out there. There's something else you should know...
That's so sad...
Listen, there's something else you should know...
You're in Texas - central Texas. A town called Splendid. We're in the basement of the local school.

dlgAnsw.text: This isn't where I belong! I can't stay here!
I've lived in Texas my whole life and I've never heard of Splendid.
I guess I'm home, kind of...

dlgLine.text: I'm sorry to tell you, but you're pretty much stuck here - we all are. But don't worry we have food, facilities, a generator, and it's secure.

dlgAnsw.text: The hell I am! Hey, thanks for everything, but I'm out of here.
You can't keep me down here! What... are you going to stop me?!

dlgLine.text: Welcome home, I guess. You should know - you're pretty much stuck here - we all are. But don't worry we have food, facilities, a generator, and it's secure.

dlgAnsw.text: The hell I am! Hey, thanks for everything, but I'm out of here.
You can't keep me down here! What... are you going to stop me?!

dlgLine.text: I understand - you've just had your whole world destroyed and you're in a lot of shock, but that feeling - that's what it's like out there.
I don't think you understand. Outside - it's not safe anymore. Everything's changed.

You were on the last flight before they grounded the planes. They were trying to control the spread of... a pandemic. It didn't work. Martial Law was declared - shelters were opened, people were evacuated. Those that stayed behind-
Like me and the whole Splendid police department. All three of us.
We were just trying to get the last few people out of the area, when your plane went down. Most of them were already... you see the real danger out there, right now is... there are things out there.
Now's not the time.
I agree...
Look, this is a lot to take in. Why don't you come talk to me when you're ready.
And... again, I'm sorry for your loss.

dlgAnsw.text: <The others go back to talking privately.>

dlgLine.text: Take your time.

dlgAnsw.text: <The others go back to talking privately.>
